error.signature: ImportError: cannot import name 'X' from partially initialized module 'Y' (most likely due to a circular import)
error.regex: ImportError: cannot import name '(\w+)' from partially initialized module

verdict.summary: Circular import detected — module A imports from B which imports from A before A is fully loaded.

dead_ends.why_fails: Does not break the cycle; both modules still depend on each other
Does not break circular dependency; may cause duplicate state

workarounds.action: Move the import inside the function that needs it (lazy import)
workarounds.how: def func(): from module_b import X — defers import until runtime

workarounds.action: Restructure modules to extract shared code into a third module
workarounds.how: Create a common.py with shared definitions imported by both A and B
